description.narrative:
Strategy # Research on current CSR practices in capture fisheries in Vietnam and consultation with multi-stakeholders to share the findings and feedbacks # CSR benchmark development for capture fisheries and pilot integration # Documentation and dissemination # Sharing workshops among supply chain actors of wild capture fisheries on good practices # Advocacy for policies update of private sectors and government related to CSR in capture fisheries
Activities # Conduct studies on current practices on CSR in capture fisheries in Vietnam focus on popular fishing methods for the high commercial fish species, priorities given to the fisheries access to FIPand MSC. # Organize consultation meetings with stakeholders in supply chain of wild capture fisheries including Govt., NGO, academia etc. to share the study findings and get the feedbacks # Develop CSR benchmarks (from the existing certifications/protocols) in consultation with the actors in the selected supply chain # Develop and implement work plan to pilot integration of CSR in the privatesector# business and practices under participatory approach # Develop innovative communication materials <(>&<)> ways (media, VINAFIS magazine and OXFAM network, social network..) and disseminate to wide ranges of stakeholders including policy makers # Documentation of good practices of integration of CSR in the private sector# business and among supply chain of capture fisheries focus FIPs (WWF, SFP, ASEAN FIP protocols) and MSC certification # Sharing workshop among actors in supply chain of wild capture fisheries on good practices and improvement # Dialogues to influence private sectors and government to update policies related to CSR in capture fisheries Implementation: The project will be coordinated by ICAFIS (VINAFIS). The collaborating partners can be VIFEP and RIMF/MARD, Can Tho University, Nha Trang University, Nong Lam University, VASEP, D-FISH/MARD, Provincial and Local Fisheries Society The role of OXFAM is to facilitate stakeholders in the dialogue for policy advocacy, link to regional and global actors through its network

participating-org.narrative: International Collaborating Centre Aquaculture and Fisheries Sustainab

International Collaborating Centre for Fisheries and Aquaculture Sustainability (ICAFIS) is an affiliation NGO under Vietnam Fisheries Society (VINAFIS) and is founded according to Decision No. 16/Q#-HNC dated on 7th March 2010 issued by VINAFIS. Our goals ICAFIS#s goal is to promote aquaculture and fisheries sustainability within Vietnam and to share experiences from Vietnam internationally,primarily to developing countries primarily in Asia-Pacific, Africa and Latin America. Policies <(>&<)> Funding ICAFIS has a strongpolicy of maximum transparency and accountability. Information on technical and financial status of the organisation are presented regularly to all ICAFIS staff and VINAFIS and can be made available to external parties as appropriate. Staff salaries are also set in a transparent manner. ICAFIS encourages staff's initiative and innovative thinking. The aquaculture and fisheries sector is extremely dynamic. Therefore its sustainability challenges can only be addressed through dynamic thinking and actions which are strongly promoted by ICAFIS' leadership. ICAFIS is a self-financed organisation. Although both private and public funds are welcome to support our activities, ICAFIS envisions ensuring its sustainability by providing services to the private sector, especially VINAFIS members, and adopting a market-led financial strategy. Key areas of focus, including core programming or projects. ICAFIS has been working widely with about 38 projects in agriculture and aquaculture sectors generally, 15 of which are relating to coastal provinces, on agriculture, aquaculture, certification, development of VietGAP, ASEAN Gap, disease identification, etc. Some of these projects are relating to natural disaster, climate change and adaptive approach for the coastal agriculture. The key area of focus of ICAFIS: - Providing advice on sustainability issues to private and public sector organizations and individuals, both in Vietnam and internationally - Developing and implementing programs and projectstowards branding, certification and traceability of aquatic products - Developing international cooperation programs and projects, especially with developing countries in Asia-Pacific, Africa and Latin America - Developing and implementing research projects on aquaculture and fisheries sustainability - Building and strengthen networks of organizations, projects, producers, etc ICAFIS has the strong and comprehensive collaborations <(>&<)> partnerships with many different institutions, which are government agencies, private sector, non-governmental organizations and research institutes. Belonging to system of VINAFIS with more than 800 local branches and 3,400 members, mainly producer, fisheries association and social enterprise in fisheries. ICAFIS take arole to promote and operation supporting of this system (include develop the link, information mapping.etc)
